byline.original: Wireless to THE NEW YORK TIMES

abstract: German merchant ships at Trieste to risk Brit naval action by operating in Adriatic; seamen on German SS Ankara apprehensive on trip from Dubrovnik, Yugoslavia
snippet: DUBROVNIK, Yugoslavia, March 31--The captain of the German merchant ship Ankara, which is loading bauxite at this port, is understood to have announced that other German ships of the twenty-seven harbored at Trieste would soon be-......

keywords.name: glocations
keywords.value: MEDITERRANEAN, AFRICA AND NEAR EAST AREAS

headline.main: NAZI SHIPS TO BRAVE ADRIATIC WAR PERIL; Yugoslavs Await British Naval Moves to Close Route

lead_paragraph: DUBROVNIK, Yugoslavia, March 31--The captain of the German merchant ship Ankara, which is loading bauxite at this port, is understood to have announced that other German ships of the twenty-seven harbored at Trieste would soon be-...
